thread.title: football | Hilliard Davidson beats Upper Arlington in Week Seven
thread.title_full: High-school football | Hilliard Davidson beats Upper Arlington in Week Seven | The Columbus Dispatch

author: The Columbus Dispatch
title: football | Hilliard Davidson beats Upper Arlington in Week Seven
text:
Ryan Royer rushed for 253 yards and a pair of scores, powering host Hilliard Davidson to a 16-7 victory over Upper Arlington in an Ohio Capital Conference Central Division game tonight.
Royer, who carried 32 times, scored on TD runs of 71 and 1 yards to pace the Wildcats (6-1, 4-0), who were outgained but made plays when they counted.
Upper Arlington (5-2, 2-2) drove the field effectively, but was hurt by two turnovers and a missed field goal.
The momentum switched rapidly in the first half.
Upper Arlington drove 80 yards in 14 plays to open the game, marking the first touchdown Davidson had allowed since week two. Danny Logan capped the methodical march with a 4-yard run.
Robert LeFevre made a 48-yard field goal for Davidson on its first series.
The Golden Bears maintained control until early in the second quarter.
Davidson, facing fourth and 1 at its own 29, gambled and went for it. Ryan Royer broke through the line and sprinted 71 yards for a touchdown, changing the complexion of the contest.
On UA's next series, quarterback Vince Murdocco mishandled an errant shotgun snap and Davidson's Zac Uphouse recovered near midfield.
The Wildcats cashed in, driving 56 yards in 11 plays for their second score, a 1-yard run by Royer with 1:54 left in the half. The extra point kick was blocked, leaving the score 16-7.
UA squandered a great scoring chance in the third quarter when Logan fumbled into the end zone on third and goal and Davidson's Dre Rodriguez recovered.
The Wildcats averted two other threats when UA missed a 28-yard field goal and they held on fourth down and 2 near midfield.
Results Hamilton Township 55, Fairfield Union 13: Trey Johnson ran for three touchdowns and scored a fourth on a kickoff return for host Hamilton Township (4-2, 2-1 Mid-State League) in a win over Fairfield Union (3-3, 1-2). BOX SCORE
DeSales 42, Warrensville Heights 7 : Dylan Todd ran for two touchdowns for host DeSales, which improved to 5-1. BOX SCORE
Other scores Bloom-Carroll 30, Amanda-Clearcreek 13
Bexley 51, Millersport 0
Fairfield Christian 27, Grove City Christian 0
Licking Valley 45, Granville 0
Cardington 34, Elgin 0
